Title: Hire Cybersecurity Expert
Description: +1 to station played on and can protect any station within a single connection. Goes away after use and nullifies a single attack OR can be used to nullify a lateral movement card on any station within its sphere of influence.

Title: Old Style Forensics Capability
Description: +1 to station. A forensics tool for old style modems allows issues to be recognized on fifteen- to  twenty-five year old hardware.

Title: Train employees
Description: +1 to station. Train employees in ICS cybersecurity. IT and Industrial Control Systems (ICS) have different security needs.

Title: Emergency Plan Upgraded
Description: +1 to station. Facility's emergency plan has been upgraded to include the latest cyberinfrastructure attack potentials.

Title: Comprehensive Backup Plan
Description: +1 to station. Also protects against ransomware.

Title: Vulnerable to Phishing
Description: Employees opened email and either clicked a link or opened an attachment sent from an attacker.

Title: Field Devices Vulnerable
Description: Access gained via field devices. Many field devices such as transformers, circuit breakers, wind farms, etc. have a vulnerable technology like Bluetooth embedded that can't be turned off.

Title: Virus Checking Software Installed
Description: Somebody installed virus checking software that causes a denial of service attack of up to 6 minutes on the industrial control system because it interrupts real-time operations. This was unintended.

Title: Control and Safety Implemented Together
Description: Control and safety features are implemented into the same hardware. Safety is now vulnerable.

Title: Alarm Suppression
Description: A local software misconfiguration or vulnerability is used to gain access and the alarm functionality of the system is suppressed.

Title: Service Modification Malware
Description: Attackers use a service modification to load malware and gain access.

Title: Functionality Not Separate
Description: Business and industrial control system networks or control safety systems not separate. Anything not separated can be attacked together.

Title: Lateral Movement
Description: The last played vulnerability on this station moves to all stations directly connected to it if the vulnerability becomes an actual attack.

Title: Offline
Description: If a station survives this attack it will be offline and unusable for points the next turn.

Title: Output Fluctuates Through Brute Force I/O
Description: Access was gained and on/off commands were switched. Causes output to fluctuate unnaturally.

Title: IT and ICS Security are the Same
Description: (Instant) -1! They're different! IT business security prioritizes confidentiality and ICS security prioritizes safety, integrity, and availability. ICS devices are also commonly real time systems that may be up to 25-years old.

Title: Insignificant Target
Description: (Instant) -1! It was too insignificant to be a target and wasn't worth attacking, but attackers found it anyway.

Title: Change Password
Description: Maker users choose a new and stronger password. Counters phishing and vulnerable field device vulnerabilities.

Title: Firewall Log Review
Description: Firewall logs are reviewed and lateral movement discovered. Cancels Lateral movement card.

Title: Separate Functionality
Mitigates: Functionality Not Separate;Control and Safety Implemented Together
Description: Separate functionality to increase security. This can be business IT and Industrial Control System (ICS) functionality or even safety and control system hardware.

Title: Repair Technician
Mitigates: Offline;Output Fluctuates Through Brute Force I/O;Mechanical Breakdown;Sewage Dumped
Description: Send a repair technician to fix anything physical including brute force attacks, mechanical breakdowns, and offline facilities.

Title: Run Analytics
Description: Run analytics on user/system behavior to notice and then stop an outsider from accessing networks. Stops access from phishing and vulnerable field devices.

Title: HALT
Mitigates: Insignificant Target;IT and ICS Security are the Same;Compliance is Enough;Authentication Provides Confidentiality
Description: Cancels any card labeled as instant. Your organization was on the ball today.

Title: Catch Rogue Employee
Mitigates: Offline;Output Fluctuates Through Brute Force I/O;Mechanical Breakdown;Sewage Dumped;Power Fluctuation
Description: Catch previous employee sending false messages to radio network and causing them to dump sewage at a Hyatt Regency hotel . Fixes Brute Force I/O, sewage dump, or offline station and happened during 2000 Maroochy Water Services, Australian attack.

Title: Upgrade SCADA Access Authentication
Mitigates: Sewage Dumped;Output Fluctuates Through Brute Force I/O
Description: +1 to station. Upgrade access authentication for SCADA (supervisory control and data acquisition) radio network so previous employees can no longer use it.

Title: Upgrade Control System
Mitigates: Output Fluctuates Through Brute Force I/O;Alarm Suppression
Description: Upgrade control system and information integrity to not accept outside/false messages that could be sent by attackers. Stops Brute Force I/O Attacks and Alarm Suppression.

Title: Denial of Service Exploit Shutdown
Description: (Power Only Vuln) Shutdown of power relay due to denial of service exploit for Siemens device vulnerability. Causes loss of station and operator life if power turned on before fixed. Only fixable with Siemens Exploit patch or if it's the wrong IP.

Title: Power Fluctuation
Description: (Power Only Vuln) Remote commands toggle circuit breakers in a rapid open-close pattern causing power fluctuations in a brute force I/O attack. Happened during 2016 Ukraine Power Grid Attack.
